title: CSP Bypass: Click handler for links with data-method="post" can cause authenticity_token to be sent off domain

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Background** - There has been [at least one case](/reports/46072) where [an attacker](/danlec) was able to insert arbitrary HTML into a submitted report - HackerOne uses a very strict Content Security Policy that prevents inline script and script from other origins - HackerOne uses an `authenticity_token` in its POSTs to guard against CSRF attacks - There is a click handler for links with a`data-method` attribute that makes it so an `` tag with a `data-method="post"` will send the CSRF token in a POST to the `href` of the link, **even if the target is a different origin** **Proof of concept** 1. Click Me!

') ``` (Yes, in general security reports involving the victim running code on the console are highly suspect. Please bear with me.) 2.
